Room.Name: A dimly lit path
Room.Description: You tread through the deep, dark forest on a dimly lit path. Up ahead you can hear the faint sounds of a village.

Exit.Description: The dimly lit path leads north through the dense forest.

Room.Name: A dimly lit path
Room.Description: You tread through the deep, dark forest on a dimly lit path. Up ahead you can hear the faint sounds of a village.

Exit.Description: The dimly lit path leads north through the dense forest.
The dimly lit path leads south through the dense forest.

Room.Name: A dimly lit path
Room.Description: You tread through the deep, dark forest on a dimly lit path. The forest here seems less dense than to the south. Northward you see the faint outline of a village.

Exit.Description: The dimly lit path leads to a village.
The dimly lit path leads south through the dense forest.

Room.Name: Entrance to the Shire
Room.Description: You stand at the entrance to the Shire. You see halflings, no more than wee tall, every which way you look. Bywater Road leads east and west.

Exit.Description: To the east runs Bywater Road.
To the south you see a dimly lit path which leads to a dense forest.
To the west runs Bywater Road.

Room.Name: Bywater Road
Room.Description: You stand on Bywater Road, the busiest street in all of Shiredom. The road continues to the east and west while to the north lies the general store.

Exit.Description: The general store lies to the north.
To the east runs Bywater Road.
To the west you see the entrance to the Shire.

Room.Name: The General Store
Room.Description: You are inside the general store. All sorts of goodies are stacked on the many shelves. Your local friendly shopkeeper is smiling patiently, waiting to serve you to the best of his abilities. The only exit is to the south.

Exit.Description: The only exit lies to the south.

Room.Name: Bywater Road
Room.Description: You stand on Bywater Road, the busiest street in all of Shiredom. The road continues to the east and west. To the north, steps lead to a friendly looking weaponry/armory while a nursery lies to the south.

Exit.Description: Steps lead to a friendly looking weaponry and armory.
To the east runs Bywater Road.
To the south lies Kid'n Keep, the local nursery.
To the west runs Bywater Road.

Room.Name: The House of Arms
Room.Description: You are inside the finest weapons and armour shop in all of Shiredom. The shopkeeper proudly displays his fine wares and humbly offers the best daggers that you have ever laid eyes on.

Exit.Description: The only exit lies to the south.

Room.Name: Kid'n Keep
Room.Description: You are inside Kid'n Keep, the convenient one-stop nursery that maintains the youth of the Shire. Toddlers run every which way while their nursemaids sigh in exasperation. The only exit lies to the north.

Exit.Description: The only exit lies to the north.

Room.Name: A bend in the road
Room.Description: Bywater Road continues west and south. A large, imposing building lies to the east. Farther to the south, you can see an Inn of some sort.

Exit.Description: A large, imposing building lies to the east. A sign reads 'Shiriff Post'.
To the south runs Bywater Road.
To the west runs Bywater Road.

Room.Name: Shiriff Post of the Eastern Shire
Room.Description: You are in the Shiriff Post which acts as the nucleus for the three shiriffs of the Eastern Shire. As you examine the shiriffs on duty, you come to realize that the halflings of the Shire are not to be reckoned with. You cower with awe. A door offers passage to the east.

Exit.Description: A door offers passage to the office of the Thain.
To the west you can see Bywater Road.

Room.Name: Thain's Office
Room.Description: You stand inside the office of the Thain, the police protectorate of the great Shire. The Thain has sworn to protect the Shire from all thieves and murderers with his life, and so eyes you suspiciously. A door to the west leads to the Shiriff Post.

Exit.Description: A door offers passage to the Shiriff Post.

Room.Name: Bywater Road
Room.Description: You stand on Bywater Road, the busiest street in all of Shiredom. The road continues to the north and south. To the east you spy the training grounds for shiriffs in training.

Exit.Description: To the north runs Bywater Road.
The Shiriff Training Grounds lies to the east.
To the south runs Bywater Road.

Room.Name: Bywater Road
Room.Description: You stand on Bywater Road, the busiest street in all of Shiredom. The road continues to the north. The private residences of Shire inhabitants are to the east and west while to the south lies the Ivy Bush, second only to the Green Dragon for its hospitality and service.

Exit.Description: To the north runs Bywater Road.
You spy the private dwelling of a Shire folk to the east.
To the south you see the Ivy Bush, a favorite haunt of Shire urbanites and seasoned travelers.
You spy the private dwelling of a Shire folk to the west.

Room.Name: A smial
Room.Description: You are inside a smial, a hole in the ground which serves as the proper dwelling place for halflings. As you look around this private abode, you feel as if you were intruding and so quickly cover your eyes. The only exit lies to the east.

Exit.Description: The only exit lies to the east.

Room.Name: A smial
Room.Description: You are inside a smial, a hole in the ground which serves as the proper dwelling place for halflings. As you look around this private abode, you feel as if you were intruding and so quickly cover your eyes. The only exit lies to the west.

Exit.Description: The only exit lies to the west.

Room.Name: The Ivy Bush
Room.Description: You are in the Ivy Bush, one of the most famous inns in all of Shiredom. Chique Shire urbanites and seasoned travelers fill the confines of the room with gay and lively talk. A jovial innkeeper stops all that he is doing to await your command. The only exit lies to the north.

Exit.Description: The only exit lies to the north.

Room.Name: Shiriff Training Grounds
Room.Description: The sounds of mock battle and feigned death cries fill your ears. Every which way you turn you see halfling trainees at the prime of their youth. A wizened old battle instructor meets your gaze and asks if he may be of service. The only exit lies to the west.

Exit.Description: The only exit lies to the west.

Room.Name: Bywater Road
Room.Description: You stand on Bywater Road, the busiest street in all of Shiredom. The road continues to the east and west. A large, imposing building lies to the south. You catch a glimpse of the Brandywine River to the north.

Exit.Description: To the east you see the entrance to the Shire.
A large, imposing building lies to the south. A sign reads 'Shiriff Post'.
To the west runs Bywater Road.

Room.Name: Shiriff Post of the Bridge
Room.Description: You are in the Shiriff Post which acts as the nucleus for the three shiriffs of the Bridge. As you examine the shiriffs on duty, you come to realize that the halflings of the Shire are not to be reckoned with. You cower with awe. The only exit is to the north.

Exit.Description: The only exit is to the north.

Room.Name: Bywater Road
Room.Description: You stand on Bywater Road, the busiest street in all of Shiredom. The road continues to the east and west. To the south you spy the Grocer's Delight, the premium grocer's shop in all the realm while to the north lies Brandywine Bridge.

Exit.Description: Brandywine Bridge offers safe passage across the tumultuous river.
To the east runs Bywater Road.
You see the Grocer's Delight to the south.
To the west runs Bywater Road.

Room.Name: The Grocer's Delight
Room.Description: You tremble with ecstasy as the tempting odors of freshly made pipeweed bread fill your lungs. Rumor has it that the pipeweed bread sold here can restore vitality. You look around but find no one to take your order. You then peep over the counter and discover a friendly grocer who is too short to be seen over the counter. The only exit is to the north.

Exit.Description: The only exit is to the north.

Room.Name: Bywater Road
Room.Description: You stand on Bywater Road, the busiest street in all of Shiredom. The road continues to the east. A small hill lies to the west while you can see a watermill to the far south. You catch a glimpse of the Brandywine River to the north.

Exit.Description: To the east runs Bywater Road.
An entrance to the watermill lies to the south.
A small hill to the west blocks your view.

Room.Name: Entrance to Watermill
Room.Description: You stand at the entrance to a watermill. You hear the bustle of busy workers and the sound of a creaking mill. Bywater Road is to the north while the watermill continues to the south.

Exit.Description: You see Bywater Road to the north.
A watermill meets your gaze.

Room.Name: The Watermill
Room.Description: Halfling workers are scattered everywhere, busy at work. You see the river to the west and get a compelling urge to grab the nearest worker and to toss him into the river. The entrance stands to the north while a door offers passage to the south.

Exit.Description: You see the entrance.
A wooden door leads to the rear of the watermill.

Room.Name: Rear of watermill
Room.Description: You stand in a damp, dimly lit room. Mildew clings to the walls and it appears as if you were the first person to enter the room in ages. A barely visible portal in the ground catches your eye.

Exit.Description: A watermill meets your gaze.
A hidden portal reveals a passageway down.

Room.Name: Took Hill
Room.Description: You stand on top of Took Hill, named after the legendary Bandobras Took. You feel honored to be standing on a hill named after your hero. From this vantage point you can see all of shiredom. You get the feeling that with one stomp you could eliminate their great city. You can see the outline of Midgaard to the far east. Sounds of joyful celebration are heard from the fields west of here. The Brandywine flows by lazily nearby.

Exit.Description: To the east runs Bywater Road.
You see a grassy field to the west.

Room.Name: Northern end of grassy field
Room.Description: You stand in a grassy field--nothing to get too excited about. The field extends toward the south and the west. To the east you see Took Hill.

Exit.Description: You see a grassy field.

Room.Name: A grassy field
Room.Description: You stand in the center of a grassy field. A great birthday party appears to be taking place. Great tables of food are spread out and a young halfling beauty offers you welcome. You are enticed by her generosity and suggestive winks.

Exit.Description: You see a grassy field.
A small hill to the east blocks your view.
You see a grassy field.
You see a grassy field.

Room.Name: Southern end of grassy field
Room.Description: You stand in a grassy field--nothing to get too excited about. The field extends toward the north and the west. To the east you see Took Hill.

Exit.Description: You see a grassy field.

Room.Name: Western end of grassy field
Room.Description: You stand in a grassy field--nothing to get too excited about. The field extends every which way but west.

Exit.Description: You see a grassy field.

Room.Name: Brandywine Bridge
Room.Description: You stand on a solidly built bridge. As you look down you spy gaily colored fish swimming with the current of Brandywine River. The cool water looks invitingly refreshing and you get a sudden urge to strip and bathe in the river, but you hear the laughter of women nearby and so resist the urge. Delving Lane extends to the north while Bywater Road can be seen to the south.

Exit.Description: You see Delving Lane.
To the south runs Bywater Road.

Room.Name: Delving Lane
Room.Description: Delving Lane runs north and south in this small borough of the Shire. To the south stands Brandywine Bridge. The Green Dragon, the undisputed leader in the art of innkeeping, offers rest and comfort to the east. You hear the bray of horses from the west.

Exit.Description: You see Delving Lane.
The Green Dragon offers food, drink, and above all hospitality for mere gold.
Brandywine Bridge offers safe passage across the tumultuous river.

Room.Name: Delving Lane
Room.Description: Delving Lane runs north and south in this small borough of the Shire. A large, imposing building lies to the east. You hear the bray of horses from the west.

Exit.Description: You see Delving Lane.
A large, imposing building lies to the east. A sign reads 'Shiriff Post'.
You see Delving Lane.
You see a grassy field.

Room.Name: Delving Lane
Room.Description: Delving Lane runs north and south in this small borough of the Shire. There is a small house to the west, nothing to the east, and up ahead you see a round door which leads to a rather impressive abode.

Exit.Description: A large, magnificent house meets your steady gaze. Above the round door a sign reads 'Bag End'.
You see Delving Lane.

Room.Name: Bag End
Room.Description: You stand in a comfortably well-equipped house, a palace by humble halfling standards. On the wall you see a banner which reads "Home Sweet Home". A solid oak door to the east leads to a pantry while you see a cozy bedroom to the west.

Exit.Description: Through the keyhole you see what looks like a well stocked pantry.
You see Delving Lane.
You see a bedroom. It looks like the beds have recently been slept in.

Room.Name: Bedroom
Room.Description: You stand in the private bedroom of Bag End. There are two beds to the side, neither of which are made. Portraits of halflings hang on the wall, and as you gaze upon them you come to the conclusion that the owner of Bag End comes from a long line of distinguished halflings. A cozy fire in the fireplace keeps the room warm and comfortable.

Exit.Description: Through the doorway you see the main room of Bag End.

Room.Name: Pantry
Room.Description: You are inside the pantry. Shelves filled with food and drink surround you on all sides. You wonder why a halfling would need so much to eat. The presence of something unseen chills you to your bones. On the floor you spy a trapdoor.

Exit.Description: Beyond the door you see the main room of Bag End.
It's anyone's guess as to where the trapdoor leads.

Room.Name: A grassy field
Room.Description: You stand upon a grassy field. A bull stands grazing not far away and out of the corner of your eye you can see him considering you. The sound of animals fill the air from the north. To the south you see a pig pen.

Exit.Description: You see a large barn.
You see Delving Lane.
A rather large pig pen is to the south.

Room.Name: Pig pen
Room.Description: You feel your boots sinking into the mud. Numerous pigs roam about, oblivious to your company. A grassy field is to the north while you see a small path winding to the west.

Exit.Description: You see a grassy field.
A small path winds its way eastward.

Room.Name: A stony path
Room.Description: You walk on a stony path which leads to a small residence to the north. From the east you hear the noisy din of pigs.

Exit.Description: To the north you see a modest house.
A rather large pig pen is to the east.

Room.Name: Gamgee Residence
Room.Description: You stand inside a modest home. You deduce that this is indeed the home of whomever owns the surrounding lands. The air is somewhat musty and the smell reminds you of a stable. As you look around disdainfully, you think to yourself that this is more of a shack than a proper residence and you long for the urban riches of the Shire proper.

Exit.Description: You see a small path winding its way southward.

Room.Name: A barn
Room.Description: Animals of every sort fill the small barn. You feel the hot breath of horses and cows on your neck and you feel the sudden need for fresh air. Other than that, you feel cozy and protected and don't mind staying for a bit longer. All the warmth and good vibes remind you of the days when your mother would hold you in her arms and sing you to sleep. You find yourself wanting to cradle all the animals.

Exit.Description: You see a chicken coop to the north.
You see a grassy field.

Room.Name: A chicken coop
Room.Description: You stand inside a rather crowded chicken coop. The cackle of hens fill the air. The only exit is to the south.

Exit.Description: You see a large barn.

Room.Name: The Green Dragon
Room.Description: Welcome to the Green Dragon, the undisputed leader in the art of innkeeping. A rather charming and friendly hostess stands to the side, ready to offer you food and drink. While most of the patrons are halfling locals, you spy an occasional human or two. As you listen more closely to the conversations that fill the inn, you hear the tales of great and seasoned adventurers as well as the usual gossip. You feel as if you've found your second home in the Green Dragon. You see a stairway leading upwards.

Exit.Description: You see Delving Lane.
You see the reception.

Room.Name: Shiriff Post of Delving Lane
Room.Description: You are in the Shiriff Post which acts as the nucleus for the three shiriffs of Delving Lane. As you examine the shiriffs on duty, you come to realize that the halflings of the Shire are not to be reckoned with. You cower with awe. The only exit is to the west.

Exit.Description: You see Delving Lane.

Room.Name: A dark tunnel
Room.Description: You stand inside a small underground tunnel. The ceiling is so low that you must crouch to avoid hitting your head. You see light from a small hole in the ceiling while to the east you see nothing but darkness.

Exit.Description: You see a dark tunnel.
You see a portal which leads to a small room.

Room.Name: A dark tunnel
Room.Description: You stand inside a small underground tunnel. The ceiling is so low that you must crouch to avoid hitting your head. The tunnel continues east and west. All you can see is darkness.

Exit.Description: You see a dark tunnel.
You see a dark tunnel.

Room.Name: A dark tunnel
Room.Description: You stand inside a small underground tunnel. The ceiling is so low that you must crouch to avoid hitting your head. The tunnel continues east and west. All you can see is darkness.

Exit.Description: You see a dark tunnel.
You see a dark tunnel.

Room.Name: A three way intersection
Room.Description: You stand at an intersection. The tunnel continues east and west while to the north you can barely make out a smaller trail.

Exit.Description: You see a dark tunnel.
You see a dark tunnel.
You see a dark tunnel.

Room.Name: End of a dark tunnel
Room.Description: You stand at the end of a dark tunnel. The underground tunnel continues to the west. From a trapdoor in the ceiling you can hear the din of adventurers.

Exit.Description: You see a dark tunnel.

Room.Name: A dark tunnel
Room.Description: You stand inside a small underground tunnel. The ceiling is so low that you must crouch to avoid hitting your head. The tunnel continues north and south. To the west you see a Shirriff Post while to the east lies a small home. All you can see is darkness.

Exit.Description: You see a dark tunnel.
You see a halfling hole.
You see a dark tunnel.
Above a great oak door you see a sign which reads 'Shirriff Post'.

Room.Name: A dark tunnel
Room.Description: You stand inside a small underground tunnel. The ceiling is so low that you must crouch to avoid hitting your head. The tunnel continues north and south. To the west lies a small home. All you can see is darkness.

Exit.Description: You see a dark tunnel.
You see a dark tunnel.
You see a halfling hole.

Room.Name: Shiriff Post of the Lower Shire
Room.Description: You are in the shiriff Post which acts as the nucleus for the three shiriffs of the Lower Shire. As you examine the shiriffs on duty, you come to realize that the halflings of the Shire are not to be reckoned with. You cower with awe. The only exit is to the east.

Exit.Description: You see a dark tunnel.

Room.Name: A halfling hole
Room.Description: You stand inside a rather crudely built halfling hole. The many passageways and winding paths remind you of a rodent's lair. The air is musty and damp and you feel the need for fresh air.

Exit.Description: You see a dark tunnel.

Room.Name: A halfling hole
Room.Description: You stand inside a rather crudely built halfling hole. The many passageways and winding paths remind you of a rodent's lair. The air is musty and damp and you feel the need for fresh air.

Exit.Description: You see a dark tunnel.

Room.Name: End of a dark tunnel
Room.Description: You are at one end of a dark tunnel. The tunnel continues to the south while on the ceiling you can make out a trapdoor.

Exit.Description: You see a dark tunnel.
A trapdoor on the ceiling reveals a passageway.

Room.Name: The Inn of the Green Dragon
Room.Description: You are standing in the Inn of the Green dragon. Large paintings of halflings at work, and halflings at play adorn the walls. Comfortable benches and seats line the walls. A stairway leads down.

NPC.name: oldstyle elven wizard
NPC.description: The Elven Wizard looks at you in a solemn sort of way. His gaze seems to penetrate through your innermost being. He is wearing a silvery cloak and holding a multi-colored staff. Although he appears to be older than the oldest man, he seems to have an inner strength which most mortals cannot overcome.
NPC.longDescription: An Elven Wizard is here, creating fireworks for the festivities.

NPC.name: oldstyle ring keeper
NPC.description: The Ring Keeper is a rather big but short halfling. His short stature and bulbous nose belie his true nature. An elven sword that glows with a blue light hangs from his belt, and on his finger you see the One Ring. Although usually a halfling of peace, he will fight you to the death if you attempt to take away that which belongs to him.
NPC.longDescription: The Keeper of the Ring is here, guarding his treasure jealously.

NPC.name: oldstyle farmer gamgee
NPC.description: Farmer Gamgee is a short, stout halfling of thirty years. His skin has been tanned from working the fields night and day. He's quite a jolly chap, always ready to befriend an injured bunny rabbit.
NPC.longDescription: Farmer Gamgee sniffs the air, wondering if harvest time is near.

NPC.name: oldstyle toddler
NPC.description: The toddler is dressed in nothing but his birthday suit. He crawls about for he hasn't learned to walk yet. He peers up at you and asks "da da?"
NPC.longDescription: A toddler crawls about, looking for something to chew on.

NPC.name: oldstyle nursemaid
NPC.description: The nursemaid looks rather tired and worn out. Taking care of so many toddlers for too long has evidently taken its toll. She looks to you and in her eyes you can see her longing for a better life.
NPC.longDescription: A nursemaid wanders about, trying to keep track of all the toddlers.

NPC.name: oldstyle cow
NPC.description: The cow looks like it hasn't been milked in quite some time. Although she is past her prime, you see that she still has a lot of years left, and that if provoked, her rear kick can be quite deadly.
NPC.longDescription: A cow is here, chewing her cud.

NPC.name: oldstyle pig
NPC.description: The pig appears quite happy to be a pig. He is oblivious to your presence and cares only for the care-free life that he leads. It is enormously fat and consequently cannot move around very quickly.
NPC.longDescription: A pig wallows in the mud and oinks in contentment.

NPC.name: oldstyle chicken
NPC.description: The chicken is bright and healthy. She has no weapons but her beak.
NPC.longDescription: A chicken sits on her nest.

NPC.name: oldstyle bull
NPC.description: The bull is in top condition. He looks like quite a fighter, nothing to be reckoned with. With his horns and his hooves he can attack just about anything.
NPC.longDescription: A bull scratches at the ground and lowers his head.

NPC.name: oldstyle horse
NPC.description: The horse looks at you and turns away. You can tell that it is afraid of you.
NPC.longDescription: A horse becomes frightened by your presence.

NPC.name: oldstyle shiriff
NPC.description: The shiriff is over waist high, quite tall for a halfling. His eyes are ever roaming, looking for signs of trouble from riff-raff like you. In his belt is a thin dagger, and on his body he wears a suit of leather armor. This is one halfling you don't want to mess with.
NPC.longDescription: A shiriff of the Shire looks for signs of trouble.
NPC.flags: NPC Scavenger StayArea Warrior Rescue AssistVnum

NPC.name: oldstyle shiriff
NPC.description: The shiriff is over waist high, quite tall for a halfling. His eyes are ever roaming, looking for signs of trouble from riff raff like you. In his belt is a thin dagger, and on his body he wears a suit of leather armor. This is one halfling you don't want to mess with.
NPC.longDescription: A shiriff of the Shire looks for signs of trouble.
NPC.flags: NPC Scavenger StayArea Warrior Rescue AssistVnum

NPC.name: oldstyle thain
NPC.description: A personable yet serious halfling, the Thain looks at you and yells a deep 'Hullo'. He walks about comfortably, secure in the knowledge that as long as he's in office, the Shire will always remain a safe haven for Shire folk.
NPC.longDescription: The Thain commands respect from all Shire folk.

NPC.name: oldstyle innkeeper
NPC.description: The Innkeeper is a jolly old halfling who spends his days eavesdropping on local gossip. In his younger days, he was quite a seasoned traveller.
NPC.longDescription: The Innkeeper stands here awaiting your order.

NPC.name: oldstyle miller
NPC.description: The Miller is an impatient young halfling, always trying to command more respect from his workers than he can get. He looks like the type of person who deserves a spanking but never got one.
NPC.longDescription: The Miller is here, overseeing his busy mill workers.

NPC.name: oldstyle mill worker
NPC.description: The mill worker is in fine shape from the hard labor that he does at the mill. He doesn't notice your presence, but he looks like he could break you in two without thinking about it.
NPC.longDescription: The mill worker runs to and fro.

NPC.name: oldstyle elven warrior
NPC.description: The tall elven warrior is light and fair-skinned. The expression that he wears on his countenance is solemn and tragic. He cares not for this world any longer and wearies of it.
NPC.longDescription: The elven warrior watches you solemnly.

NPC.name: oldstyle dwarven prince
NPC.description: Grim and cold, the dwarven prince is quite strong and bulky, even for the dwarves of his land. His glowing eyes peer out of his bushy face and stare beyond your gaze.
NPC.longDescription: The dwarven prince sits here patiently for the return of his king.

NPC.name: oldstyle shopkeeper
NPC.description: The shopkeeper will fight like a madman to protect his store from riff-raff like you.
NPC.longDescription: The shopkeeper smiles and patiently waits for you to buy something.

NPC.name: oldstyle grocer
NPC.description: The grocer is a large, jovial halfling who knows how to enjoy his pipeweed. However, he also knows that it's worth protecting and so will do everything in his power to prevent riff-raff like you from stealing it.
NPC.longDescription: The grocer offers you the finest breads in all the land.

NPC.name: oldstyle blacksmith
NPC.description: The blacksmith is a lean and mean fighting machine. His knowledge of weapons and armour would certainly help him in any fight against riff-raff like you.
NPC.longDescription: The blacksmith bids you welcome to his humble store.

NPC.name: oldstyle battle master
NPC.description: The battle master is a wizened fighter, with many scars to prove his worth.
NPC.longDescription: The battle master offers you the services of his fine trainees.

NPC.name: oldstyle halfling youth
NPC.description: The halfling youth is not yet quite in the prime of his youth. He's knee high and you get the sudden urge to step on him.
NPC.longDescription: A halfling youth stands here, waiting for nothing in particular.

NPC.name: oldstyle seasoned adventurer
NPC.description: The seasoned adventurer has seen his share of glory days. Although he is past his prime, he still looks like he could put up more than his share of a good fight.
NPC.longDescription: A seasoned adventurer sits here, telling tales of fame and fortune.

NPC.name: oldstyle local gossip
NPC.description: The gossip is all talk and no action. You're transfixed by her ability to talk so much so quickly.
NPC.longDescription: A local gossip asks you, "Have you heard the latest?"

NPC.name: oldstyle halfling beauty
NPC.description: She is the most beautiful creature you've seen in quite some time. As you stare at her, thoughts of all else vanish. You get the sudden urge to grovel at her feet, hoping she'll take you in like a lost puppy. You wouldn't dare harm a hair on her precious little head.
NPC.longDescription: A halfling beauty stares dreamily into your eyes.

NPC.name: oldstyle trainee
NPC.description: The trainee smiles smugly, aware of your interest in him. He's a little fresh, but his enthusiasm and desire to please more than make up for what he lacks in skill.
NPC.longDescription: A trainee screams a death cry as he delivers the fatal blow to a dummy.

NPC.name: oldstyle chic urbanite
NPC.description: The urbanite seems very much at home in his surroundings. His clothes are all of the latest fashions and his manners impeccable. He offers you some coins if you'd be so good as to order a drink for him.
NPC.longDescription: A chic urbanite sits here, enjoying his class status.

NPC.name: oldstyle country bumpkin
NPC.description: The country bumpkin snores noisily.
NPC.longDescription: A country bumpkin dreams of pipeweed and its many uses.

NPC.name: oldstyle innkeeper
NPC.description: The Innkeeper is a jolly old halfling who spends his days eavesdropping on local gossip. In his younger days, he was quite a seasoned traveller.
NPC.longDescription: The Innkeeper stands here awaiting your order.

NPC.name: oldstyle receptionist
NPC.description: He is a very professional looking type.
NPC.longDescription: The receptionist sits here, signing forms.

NPC.name: oldstyle shiriff
NPC.description: The shiriff is over waist high, quite tall for a halfling. He looks at you, smiles and asks you if you have seen a halfling youth somewhere outside the shire.
NPC.longDescription: A shiriff of the Shire looks for the lost halfling youth.

ExtraDescription.Description: Welcome to the Shire. As you enter the Shire from Haon-Dor you come under the jurisdiction of the Thain, the peacekeeper of the Shire. Consequently, by entering these lands you agree to obey our laws. If you break these laws, you will be severely punished. We do not like riff raff in our peaceful town. The Thain Peacekeeper of the Shire

Item.Name: pipeweed bread
Item.LongDescription: A loaf of pipeweed bread arouses your hunger.

Item.Name: thain girth
Item.LongDescription: The girth of the thain lies here.

Item.Name: bag
Item.LongDescription: A bag is on the floor.

Item.Name: lantern
Item.LongDescription: A lantern is on the floor.

Item.Name: bardiche
Item.LongDescription: A long weapon with a sharp end is on the floor.

Item.Name: flail
Item.LongDescription: A flail is on the floor.

Item.Name: wooden bardiche

Item.Name: club heavy
Item.LongDescription: You see see a heavy club. Looks just right for whomping heads.
